intro: Brasilaelia tenebrosa, commonly known as the dark brasilaelia, is a species of evergreen tree native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves that are often dark green in color. The tree produces showy, violet to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its bark is thick and fissured, providing a distinctive appearance. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
